direction.raw_text: (S) Crows attacking side window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (S) Hand on horn ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P) Cathy and Michele's faces huddled together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P) Melanie's big head - she looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP (1) (P) Knob of wiper -- her hand comes in and pulls it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (FP) Wipers starting. Crows retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P) The three faces staring out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P) through windshield. The crows are starting to go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P) Melanie looks out and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (FP) through windshield. Annie running back with stick. She beats the last of the crows away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (S) Melanie flops in exhaustion over the wheel as Annie comes round to the side window and starts to open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE TIDES - FULL SHOT It is lunchtime and there is a busy bustle to the place as DEKE CARTER officiates behind the bar and HELEN CARTER, his wife, rushes back and forth between diners at the tables. A DRUNK sits at the bar, old, grizzled, the weary wisdom of booze in him. In one of the booths sits SEBASTIAN SHOLES in his shirt sleeves, eating a hurried lunch quickly and efficiently. A WOMAN and TWO CHILDREN are seated at another table, about to order. A party of noisy SALESMAN is laughing and clowning around throughout following at a table in the rear. The phone from behind the bar has been placed on the counter, and Melanie is speaking into it while Deke listens. Over her head, the television set is blasting with its perennial Western, the gun shots punctuating her conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, there were hundreds of them. No, I'm not hysterical, I'm trying to tell you this as calmly as I know how. All right, Daddy. Yes Daddy. (she takes a deep breath) Just now.  Not... fifteen minutes ago. The door to the Tides opens and MRS. BUNDY, sixtyish, wearing walking shoes and a tweed suit, a very masculine-looking woman with short clipped white hair, comes in, passes through foreground, goes to bar, her attention slowly caught by what Melanie is saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the school. No, I don't. Just a minute. (to Deke) What's the name of the school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the Bodega Bay School. (to Mrs. Bundy) Help you, Mrs. Bundy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need some change, Mr. Carter. As Deke opens cash register...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bodega Bay School. (to Deke) Could you turn that down, please? Deke gives Mrs. Bundy her change, turns off television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how many children. Thirty or forty. Yes. Mrs. Bundy goes to cigarette machine, pauses to listen to Melanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, the birds didn't attack until the children were outside the school. Crows, I think. I don't know, Daddy. Is there a difference between crows and blackbirds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is very definitely a difference, Miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're different, Daddy. (to Mrs. Bundy) Thank you. (into phone) I think these were crows. Yes, hundreds of them. Yes, they attacked the children, attacked them. (exasperated) Daddy, a little girl was sent to the hospital in Santa Rosa. Well, all right, but you act as if I'm... all right, all right. (pause) No, I can't come home now. I just can't, Daddy. How is it there? I mean... are there birds? In the sky? But no trouble. Well, I hope... (pause) I don't know when. I simply can't leave now. Tell Mother not to worry. All right, Daddy, good-by. She hangs up. Mrs. Bundy is at her elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're both perching birds, of course, but of quite different species. The crow is brachyrhynchos. The blackbird is cyanocephalus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (to Deke) Do you know Dan Fawcett's number?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the book right here, Miss. As Melanie looks it up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see what difference it makes, Mrs. Bundy, crows or blackbirds. If they attacked the school, that's pretty serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hardly think either species would have the intelligence to launch a massed attack. Their brain pans aren't large enough for such...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just came from the school, madam. I don't know about their brain pans but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birds are not aggressive creatures, Miss. They bring beauty to the world. It is mankind, rather, who...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three Southern fried chicken, Sam. Baked potato on all of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from salesman at table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, may I speak to Mitch Brenner, please? (pause) Yes, I'll wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...insist on making it difficult for life to survive on this planet. If it weren't for birds...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Bundy, you don't seem to understand. This young lady says there was an attack on the school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitch? I'm glad I caught you. Something terrible has happened. Her background conversation continues through following:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the end of the world!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this about the school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bunch of crows attacked the school, Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the end of the world. (suddenly quoting) "Thus saith the Lord God to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers and to the valleys; Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lord's not destroying anything, Jason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "In all your dwelling places, the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be laid waste!" (he nods) Ezekiel, Chapter six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning that they may follow strong drink."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isaiah, Chapter 5. It's the end of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, all right, I'll wait for you. Good-by. (she hangs up)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hardly think a few birds are going to bring about the end of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These weren't a few birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waiting for their lunch, listening to the conversation; becoming very nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't even know there were many crows in Bodega Bay this time of year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crow is a permanent resident throughout its range. In fact, during our Christmas Count, we recorded...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many gulls did you count, Mrs. Bundy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUNDY Which gulls, Mr. Sholes? There are several varieties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ones that've been raising the devil with my fishing boats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably herring gulls. They arrive in November, you know, and don't migrate North again until March or...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you had trouble with gulls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of my boats did last week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This young lady got hit by a gull only Saturday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick up the chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it's gulls. A minute ago, it was crows. (she picks up tray, shrugs, goes to table) Deke, I'm still waiting for those Bloody Marys!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming right up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Helen brings food. She is beginning to get really frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you ask them to lower their voices, please? They're frightening the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timmy has a canary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice. Are you Timmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My cousin is Timmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaving table, coming to bar) A whole flock of gulls nearby capsized one of my boats.  Practically tore of the skipper's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're scaring the kids. Keep it low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're scaring me, too. Are you trying to say all these... (he shakes his head) That sounds impossible, Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only telling you what happened to my boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gulls were after your fish, Mr. Sholes. Really, let's be logical about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were the crows after at the school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think they were after, Miss...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniels. I think they were after the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what purpose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To... (she hesitates) To kill them. There is a long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Another silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought not. Birds have been on this planet since archaeopteryx, Miss Daniels; a hundred and twenty million years ago!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to bar, listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it seem odd that they'd wait all that time to start a... a war against humanity?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one called it a war!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scotch, light on the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Mr. Sholes seem to be implying as much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you finished here, Sebastian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me have some apple pie, Helen. (to Mrs. Bundy) Who said anything about war? All I said was that some gulls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One apple pie! You want more coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. ...came down on one of my boats. They could have been after the fish, just as you said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your captain should have shot at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gulls are scavengers, anyway. Most birds are. If you ask me, we should wipe them all out. World would be better off without them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, birds. All they do is make a mess of everything. Who needs them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if they're starting a war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are incapable of organized warfare!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever seen a jay protecting a nest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have seen jays doing everything it is conceivable for jays to do. Ornithology happens to be my avocation, Miss Daniels. You're talking about preservation of the species, a hen protecting her young. There's a vast difference between...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they're all protecting the species. Maybe they're tired of being shot at and roasted in ovens and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you discussing gamebirds now? All birds are not gamebirds, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything about birds except that they're attacking this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then fight back. Get yourselves guns and wipe them off the face of the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would hardly be possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not, Mrs. Bundy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because there are 8,650 species of birds in the world today, Mr. Carter. It's estimated that five billion, seven hundred and fifty million birds live in the United States alone. The five continents of the world...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them all. Get rid of them. Messy animals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...probably contain more than a hundred billion birds!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the end of the world!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we seem to have more than our share of them right now, Mrs. Bundy. Maybe this young lady's right.  Maybe they've all gone crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's your pie, Sebastian. You want it at the table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Here's fine. (he begins eating)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the Bloody Marys, Deke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we running a business here -- or a bird sanctuary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, those gulls must have been after the fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makes a lot more sense than... well, an attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it does. If we believe that birds are attacking, why... why next we'll believe that grasshoppers and cockroaches are capable of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cockroaches!  Urghh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: getting more and more anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry, children. Finish your lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are the birds gonna eat us, Mommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we're all getting a little carried away by this. Admittedly, a few birds acted strangely. That's no reason to believe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't a few birds! I keep telling you that! These are gulls and swifts and crows and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what? Vultures? Hawks? Eagles?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe! Is it impossible?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I have never known birds of different species to flock together. The very concept is unimaginable. (laughing) Why if that happened, we wouldn't have a chance. How could we possible hope to fight them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We couldn't. You're right, Mrs. Bundy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, may I have a check, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything all right, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I... I'm anxious to get on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? Something wrong out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're fighting a war, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A war? Against who? Did the Russians...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Against birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you all think this is so amusing. You've frightened my children half out of their wits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not scared, Mommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep quiet. If that young lady saw an attack on the school, why won't you believe her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What attack? Who attacked the school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birds did. Crows! And you're all sitting around here debating! What do you want them to do next? Crash through that window?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mommy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet! Why don't you all get home? Lock your doors and windows! (her hysteria rising) Put on your coats, children! (to Deke) What's the fastest road to San Francisco?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The freeway, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do I get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going out that way, lady. You can follow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's go. Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't finished my drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put on your coats! Do you want to get trapped here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't find my scarf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look in your sleeve! The door opens. Mitch and Al Malone come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie? At the far table, the salesman begin singing, rowdily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got here as fast as I could. Where's Cathy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At Annie's house. She's all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Al, why aren't you over there where the attack was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I just got back from Dan Fawcett's place, that's why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was killed last night. By birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now hold it, Mitch. You don't know that for a fact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are the facts, Mr. Malone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santa Rosa police think it was a felony murder. They think a burglar broke in and killed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were the Santa Rosa police at your school today? (impatiently, to salesman) Are you coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, lady. (through window) There isn't a bird anywhere in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Look at the birds of the air: they do not sow or read, yet your heavenly father feeds them."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never feed another bird as long as I live!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like this happened in Santa Cruz last year. The town was covered with seagulls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you please finish your drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, sir, I recall it. A large flock of seagulls got lost in a fog and headed in for the town, where all the lights were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They made some mess, too, smashing into houses and everything. (shaking his head) They always make a mess. We're better off without them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The point is that no one seemed to get upset about it. They were gone the next morning, just as if nothing at all had happened. Poor things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving! Are you coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, all right! (he downs his drink) Hope you figure this out, folks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the end of the world. The Tides is silent for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'd better get back to the cannery. What do I owe you, Deke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see. Scallops and coffee...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it just a minute, Sebastian. Sholes turns to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (on edge of panic, shouting at her children)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: his face very serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian, I'm not an alarmist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one ever said you were, Mitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we're in trouble. I don't know how or why this started, but I know it's here and I know we'd be crazy to ignore it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignore what? The bird war?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the bird war, the bird attack, the bird plague, you can call it what you want to, they're out there massing someplace and they'll be back, you can count on that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ridiculous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Bundy, why don't you go home and polish your binoculars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, Mitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we don't do something now, if we don't get Bodega Bay on the move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mitch, even if this is true, even if all the birds...

direction.raw_text: Do you believe it's true, Sebastian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't, Mitch. Because I can't see any reason for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's happening. Isn't that a good enough reason?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like Bodega Bay as well as any man. If I thought... (he shakes his head)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then help me, Sebastian. You're an important man in this town. If you'll help, the rest will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help how? What do you want to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't even know what you want to do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to him, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You listen to him, Sebastian!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only know we've got to drive them away from town -- before they drive us away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Bundy, you said something about Santa Cruz. About seagulls getting lost in the fog, and heading in for the lights.

direction.raw_text: We don't have any fog this time of year, Mitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll make our own fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you plan to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an ordinance against burning anything in this town, unless it's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll use smoke pots. Like the Army uses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What good'll that do? Smoke's as bad as birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birds are not bad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can we go on living here if we blanket the town with smoke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we go on living here otherwise? Pause. They are silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's worth a try, Sebastian. There is more silence as they all consider. And then suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! They turn toward the window.

direction.raw_text: Gulls!

direction.raw_text: They're back!

direction.raw_text: They're only the usual... What are you...

Three or four gulls are still attacking and they flutter away as the men appear to beat them off. Suddenly Melanie in the foreground turns in full profile to her right and looks down.

He is in the act of lighting his dead cigar, but his attention is drawn to the happenings around the gas station. With this half-drawn attention, he strikes the match and holds it to the cigar.

direction.raw_text: A very high shot shows the beginning of the people of the town rushing around the car park and the streets across the highway, endeavoring to put out the two fires. We see automobiles coming to a stop on Highway One, and the oil smoke beginning to rise from the burning gas station and the parked cars. Some men have managed to start a fire hose and have trained it on the burning cars. Suddenly but slowly the foreground in the sky just below the CAMERA begins to fill with wheeling gulls. The whole picture below becomes obliterated by the foreground birds who now begin to swoop down on the town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raking shot outside the Tides Restaurant showing the phone booth and motel off in the background. People are rushing out from the restaurant and look up in the sky. Gulls begin to descend into the scene, driving the people back into the restaurant. Melanie is seen in the distance calling for Mitch:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MELANIE in the phone booth. She turns and looks swiftly in the direction of the car park.

direction.raw_text: The fire volunteers with birds descending around them drop their hose.

To the left we see a horse with its head covered with gulls; its palomino-colored body covered with crows. It is bucking and leaping and kicking its van to pieces. At this moment the scene is obliterated by the appearance of a man groping his way closely past the phone booth windows. His face is poring with blood: his head and shoulders are covered with attacking birds. He disappears from sight. Melanie, now almost in a faint, opens her eyes to see Tides Town. Through the booth window she sees Mitch and Deke Carter, the owner of the Tides, coming down toward the CAMERA and waving the birds away from them with flailing arms.

direction.raw_text: looking across in horror.

direction.raw_text: as she drops the wood outside the door and he joins her. She is looking out over the bay when he comes to her. This is not the Melanie we saw at the beginning of the picture. Her hair is disarrayed, and her face and clothing are streaked with soot. But beyond a surface physical appearance, there is a weary wisdom in her eyes, and a strength to her as she stands looking toward the distant smoldering town.

direction.raw_text: Continuing with the local news, police are still investigating the series of valuable jade burglaries in the Chinatown area. The round-up of known criminals has not as yet produced a suspect, but Commissioner Nelson said today he was certain the burglaries were quote linked and the work of the team of professionals unquote. (pause) In Bodega Bay early this morning, a large flock of crows attacked a group of children who were leaving the school during a fire drill. One little girl was seriously injured and taken to the hospital in Santa Rosa, but the majority of children reached safety in the town. (pause) On the national scene today, the opening of the new session of Congress was marked by a State of the Union address that...

direction.raw_text: Is that all?

direction.raw_text: ...drew a standing ovation for the President. The Chief Executive, in discussing our relation to Europe and the rest of the world community said: "These various elements of our foreign policy lead as I have said to a single goal -- MITCH (sighing) We're going to need more wood for the fire. We can't let it go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The goal of a peaceful world of free and independent states.  This is our guide for the present and our vision for the future -- a free community of nations, independent but interdependent, uniting north and south, east and west, in one great family of man, outgrowing and transcending the hates and fears that rend our age.  We will not reach that goal today or tomorrow.  We may not reach it in our lifetime.  But the quest is the great adventure of our century.  We sometimes chafe at the burdens of our obligations, the complexity of our decisions, the agony of our choices, but there is no comfort or security for us in evasion, no solution in abdication, no relief in irresponsibility. (pause) In assuming the tasks of the Presidency, I said that few generations, in all history, had been granted the role of being the great defender of freedom in its hour of maximum danger.  This is our good fortune, and I welcome it now as I did when I first took office. (pause) For it is the fate of this generation -- Of you in the Congress and of me as President -- to live with a struggle we did not start, in a world we did - not make. direction.raw_text: Mitch?  Do... do you think they'll be all right? In the trunk? Can they breath?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they'll be all right, honey. There is hope on their faces as the car streaks into the wind. Not a wild exuberance, but a relaxation of tension. They stare ahead through the windshield, and then they squint their eyes against the sudden sunrise ahead, and Mitch reaches up to turn down the sun visor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks... it looks clear up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moving AWAY FROM THE CAMERA FAST into magnificent sunrise over the crest of the hills. Further and further into the distance it goes.
direction.name: direction
